results.name: Triangle, read by rows, where T(n,k) = n!/(k!*(n-3*k)!*3^k) for n>=3*k>=0.
comment: Row n contains 1+floor(n/3) terms. Row sums yield A001470. Given column vector V = A118932, then V is invariant under matrix product T*V = V, or, A118932(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} T(n,k)*A118932(k). Given C = Pascal's triangle and T = this triangle, then matrix product M = C^-1*T yields M(3n,n) = (3*n)!/(n!*3^n), 0 otherwise (cf. A100861 formula due to Paul Barry).
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..150 of the triangle, flattened
program: flatten([[0 if n<3*k else f(n)/(3^k*f(k)*f(n-3*k)) for k in [0..n/3]] for n in [0..20]]) # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 07 2021
